snippet: The world’s largest maker of cellphones by volume lowered its forecast on Wednesday as demand for its Symbian-based smartphones, which the company is phasing out, weakened sharply.
abstract: Nokia lowers its first-quarter profit forecast as demand for its Symbian-based smartphones weakens amid the transition to devices using Microsoft's Windows Phone software.
lead_paragraph: The world’s largest maker of cellphones by volume lowered its forecast on Wednesday as demand for its Symbian-based smartphones, which the company is phasing out, weakened sharply.

headline.seo: Nokia Lowers Estimate for First-Quarter Profit
headline.main: Nokia Lowers Its Estimate for Profit in First Quarter
headline.print_headline: Nokia Lowers Its Estimate for Profit in First Quarter
